text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen I am 
still in Thailand today and today we are making

an egg salad now if you're thinking you know that 
Mayo-ey egg salad in your sandwiches get rid of that

idea because this is as different as could be 
in tie this dish is called yum kai tom and yum is a

type of salad kai is egg and tom is to boil 
so it's literally a boiled egg salad now this

is very different because it's full full of 
herbs it's very tart and spicy and it makes

a very pretty appetizer so let's get started 
first order of business eggs I am using duck

eggs today four of them now you can use chicken 
eggs but you know my mom's colleagues happens

to have ducks at her house so she brings these 
eggs in for sales sometimes so I boiled these

for eight minutes and now everybody's got 
their own technique for boiling eggs and

you'll see what 8-minute looks like in a 
minute but by eight minutes I mean I drop

the eggs in after the water has come to a full 
boil drop the eggs eight minutes okay make sure

you've got enough water so that when you drop 
the eggs the water doesn't stop boiling for a

significant amount of time so that way you know 
your timing doesn't get messed up so I'll just

show you a little technique for peeling eggs 
if you're interested that is I just crack it

a little bit so that the whole thing is crack 
now duck eggs if you're wondering why I'm using

duck eggs other than the fact that I have them 
has firmer whites and much brighter orange ear

yokes which has a stronger flavor okay and then 
when I go to peel it I run it under cold water

so the pressure of the water helps separate 
the shell from the egg and because duck egg

whites a firmer I find them a little easier to 
peel than chicken eggs yep and you can just feel

it when water goes in between the shell and 
the a it just comes out a little bit easier

so now that we've got our eggs figured out we're 
going to do the herbs portion and the dressing so

we're going to make a little herb salad basically 
and it's going to go on top of our eggs so I've

got a selection of herbs here and you can 
definitely change all this but this is what

I have cilantro some roughly chopped cilantro and 
some green onions now green onions in Thailand are

about the size of chives because if you're looking 
at this you're thinking those aren't green onions

this is about as big as they get here as with lots 
of other vegetables things are just much smaller

here so some chopped up and then some shallots 
thinly thinly sliced we're eating this raw so

you want to make sure it's not too thick and again 
Thai shallots are really about the size of marbles

and then over here is something called sawtooth 
coriander now we got this from our garden it's

a sister to cilantro so it's got a similar issue 
a ver smell even though it's different but if you

don't like cilantro you may not like this either 
so just a heads up but it adds um a very very nice

flavour in-lap and thumb yum as well this is great 
finally lemongrass to add some citrus enos to our

salad we also got our lemongrass from the garden 
I used about this much so just about know this

one was a bit longer so it's about two inches of 
the bottom part which is the most flavorful we're

eating lemongrass you want to make sure you chop 
them very very finely otherwise they're kind of

uncomfortable to eat then we've got our chilies 
and we're going to start mixing it all up so I'm

going to mix my dressing in this tiny little 
mortar here which I love and it's tiny little

pestle so we're going to go in with the chilies 
you can chop the chilies but I like to pound it

too so you don't get surprised little chunks if 
I pound it until fine then there's sort of no

way you can accidentally get a big chunks so when 
you get it to about here and I know there's big

pieces of skin that's okay that's not the spicy 
part the spicy part is already all pounded up

and then big piece of skin is easy to pick out 
and I'm going to use this as my salad dressing

bowl I'm going to go in with two tablespoons 
of lime juice okay mix it in now I wish I had

a whole line to show you but also Thai limes are 
about this big and they they only give out one to

one and a half tablespoons of juice so you won't 
even need a whole lime if you're using American

limes and then a tablespoon of fish sauce and 
then 2 teaspoons of palm sugar now palm sugar

I'm using the type that's soft as you can see I 
can just kind of like soft play-doh so the melts

pretty easily if you're using the hard type you 
want to make sure you chop it very finely before

you mix it so it melts easily I'm going to just 
mix it until the sugar is dissolved and then at

this point you want to taste it and it's going to 
taste pretty strong but you know you want to know

if you've got the right acidity saltiness and 
whatnot because you don't want to change it at

the end this is a lot of kind of salad you can 
toss and then you know add and the just after

it's done because it's going on top of medium 
boiled eggs so this is kind of what it looks like

whoo-hoo that's spicy okay last thing dried shrimp 
dried shrimp I use this in papaya salad and Pad

Thai I soaked them in some water just to soften 
what I want to do is pound them until they're

fluffy bits if I had my coffee grinder here 
I grind them in a coffee grinder I don't even

need to soak them and they'll just turn into 
shreds in seconds but I don't have my coffee

grinder here so what I'm going to do is pound 
them old-school in a mortar and pestle these

dry trim actually add a really nice umami flavor 
to this salad if you don't want to you don't have

to add it but I think they make a significant 
difference okay because they're kind of salty

and shrimpy and you know something that eggs 
don't have so pounded that's it you just keep

going it's gonna take a while before they shred 
say you did take the time to do all this what

you would get is fluffy shreds like this I did 
this earlier so that's kind of what you're going

for if you use the grinder it would be even 
more fine but I'm happy with that okay we're

almost ready in fact we are ready we're going 
to make some salad okay here's our salad bowl

it goes all of our herbs or cilantro lemongrass 
again I'd like to stress you can customize the

choice of herbs you can customize the amount 
and then I'm going to pour in my dressing mmm

sounds very good already and then mix it with 
these tongs that are very large for what it's

doing right now okay so that's done now we're 
going to cut open our eggs apparently the best

way to cut eggs without smearing the egg yolk 
all over the place is using a piece of thread

or dental floss but I'm just going to use a 
knife today because I don't really care too

much about how well the yolk cuts because it's 
gonna yeah cuz yolks gonna get all covered up

anyway which is kind of a shame because it's so 
perfectly cooked this is what you're looking for

moist yolks not too runny especially duck eggs 
because when it's too raw duck eggs do have kind

of a raw smell to it that chicken eggs don't have 
so you're doing chicken eggs you can do a little

you know as ready as you like okay so I've got 
those I'm going to cut them all up when I boil

eggs I always like to do one extra because if 
you cut one open and then you realize that oh

is undercooked or whatever you can always 
throw the rest back in and boil it longer

you can cut them into quarters as well if 
they're a little more cooked okay and then

I'm going to oh you know what I'm going to do 
I'm going to put some other dried shrimps in

here and save some the final final tossing so 
you're going to just trying to master the art

of even distribution okay so you can already 
just imagine sour salty spicy lots of umami

from fish sauce and dried shrimp it does good 
news on good news all over it and let it run to

the bottom doesn't that look pretty and it's so 
easy barely have to do anything okay final touch

our dried shrimp now you can serve this as an 
appetizer you can have this with rice you can

have this with again congee would be really good 
you can do little quail eggs and make super cute

bite-size young type oh I just came up with that 
idea I should have done that how cute would that

be and that is it that is our yam kite boom now 
so there was a little bit of a technical issue

in size so we're here eating outside where it's 
much nicer anyway here we go they're always a bit

slippery so I always want to eat them in sort 
of a contained environment add a little extra

dressing on top now this is probably one bite 
for some of you but even this is a bit big for me

mmm it's just so good I mean if you've never 
had an ex out like this I mean the idea of

an egg salad will change forever for you this 
is just a million times better you can eat I

can eat this days and never get bored of it 
so I hope you give it a try it's super easy

and if you can't find sawtooth coriander 
don't worry about it use just whatever you

have try it out let me know how it goes either 
through Facebook Twitter Instagram or through

my website if you enjoy the show please 
click to subscribe and oh the recipe is

as per usual on Hawkeye kitchen calm and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious kymia
